job_details.Functieomschrijving:
* Build squeaky-clean (production-grade) code for our platform and its individual components, including a generative AI tool that has already produced over 40+ million images.
     * Ensure we stay on course. E.g., by limiting tech debt, fostering a collaborative spirit, and co-creating an effective way of working.
     * Contribute to the launch of community tools.
     * Promote agility and, together with the team, iterate fast and make data-driven decisions.
     * Steer technical roadmaps and guide responsible innovation.
     * Contribute to a culture where feedback and knowledge-sharing are a given.

   As Lead Go Engineer, you are one of the drivers of ongoing platform success and (help) develop and deliver products and apps that are seen, utilized, and (hopefully) loved by 4m+ global users. Given the scope and complexity, the role calls for in-depth tech expertise, as well as the ability to rally peers behind your vision. Wearing the 'Lead' hat means a high level of technical leadership in the domain, rather than managerial responsibilities, which we hope you'll consider a plus. Together with fellow developers, engineers, designers, and product managers, you'll zoom in on forward-looking products and services. These include AI-driven tools, some of which are quickly maturing, while others are still in their infancy, like our chatbot. What does our expanding user community expect and desire from us? And how can we deliver? You'll also build and implement services that interact with the platform to ensure scalability, reliability, and security.
job_details.full_text:
Lead Go Engineer

* Build squeaky-clean (production-grade) code for our platform and its individual components, including a generative AI tool that has already produced over 40+ million images.
     * Ensure we stay on course. E.g., by limiting tech debt, fostering a collaborative spirit, and co-creating an effective way of working.
     * Contribute to the launch of community tools.
     * Promote agility and, together with the team, iterate fast and make data-driven decisions.
     * Steer technical roadmaps and guide responsible innovation.
     * Contribute to a culture where feedback and knowledge-sharing are a given.

   As Lead Go Engineer, you are one of the drivers of ongoing platform success and (help) develop and deliver products and apps that are seen, utilized, and (hopefully) loved by 4m+ global users. Given the scope and complexity, the role calls for in-depth tech expertise, as well as the ability to rally peers behind your vision. Wearing the 'Lead' hat means a high level of technical leadership in the domain, rather than managerial responsibilities, which we hope you'll consider a plus. Together with fellow developers, engineers, designers, and product managers, you'll zoom in on forward-looking products and services. These include AI-driven tools, some of which are quickly maturing, while others are still in their infancy, like our chatbot. What does our expanding user community expect and desire from us? And how can we deliver? You'll also build and implement services that interact with the platform to ensure scalability, reliability, and security.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software engineering (Go, platform development, community tools, user-facing applications) and mentions AI-driven tools and a chatbot as features of the platform. However, it lacks specific details about core AI/ML tasks like model development, fine-tuning, RAG implementation, or deep involvement with generative models beyond their integration into existing products. The emphasis is on leading code quality, technical roadmaps, and building scalable services, which aligns more with a senior software engineering role that *uses* AI components rather than one that *develops* them. The mention of 'generative AI tool that has already produced over 40+ million images' and 'AI-driven tools' suggests the *use* of AI rather than the *engineering* of AI models themselves. Therefore, it doesn't fit the core responsibilities of an ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer.

job_tasks.justification: Phrases like 'Build squeaky-clean (production-grade) code for our platform and its individual components', 'launch of community tools', 'build and implement services that interact with the platform to ensure scalability, reliability, and security', and 'develop and deliver products and apps' directly relate to traditional software engineering practices.
job_tasks.phrase: Build squeaky-clean (production-grade) code for our platform and its individual components

job_tasks.justification: Contributing to community tools falls under the development of software components.
job_tasks.phrase: Contribute to the launch of community tools

job_tasks.justification: Building and implementing services to ensure scalability, reliability, and security are core software development and architecture tasks.
job_tasks.phrase: build and implement services that interact with the platform to ensure scalability, reliability, and security

job_tasks.justification: Phrases like 'Ensure we stay on course', 'Steer technical roadmaps', 'guide responsible innovation', and understanding user expectations ('What does our expanding user community expect and desire from us? And how can we deliver?') indicate a need to align technical work with business goals and strategy.
Steering technical roadmaps and guiding innovation requires understanding business objectives and future direction.
job_tasks.phrase: Steer technical roadmaps and guide responsible innovation

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'production-grade' code and ensuring 'scalability, reliability, and security' for services implies a focus on operational aspects of deployed software, though not explicitly MLOps for AI models.

The description mentions 'a generative AI tool that has already produced over 40+ million images' and 'AI-driven tools', and 'our chatbot'. While it doesn't detail the *creation* or *fine-tuning* of these models, it implies involvement in their development or integration.
Mentioning 'AI-driven tools' and 'chatbot' indicates work related to generative models or AI applications.

soft_skills.phrase: co-creating an effective way of working
Together with fellow developers, engineers, designers, and product managers
Contribute to a culture where feedback and knowledge-sharing are a given
